attributes.action: Provide funding to make more NHS dentists available
attributes.additional_details: Many dentists are not taking on new NHS patients. Private practices are in abundance but I think the average working person cannot afford their fees. I think we are going backwards in providing basic dental care.
attributes.background: I want the government to provide funding and encourage dentists to reopen their lists for NHS patients.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

other_parliamentary_business.body:
On 22 May, MPs debated access to NHS dentistry.
This was a Backbench Business debate led by Melanie Onn MP. Health Minister Karin Smyth MP responded on behalf of the Government.
Read the transcript (https://hansard.parliament.uk/commons/2025-05-22/debates/D0CDADD7-362A-4106-A579-BA636D5E41E6/AccessToNHSDentistry)
Watch it in full (https://parliamentlive.tv/event/index/5a4d2b4e-015b-47ea-9d15-5bee36cb005a?in=15:44:20)
Explainer
Backbench Business debates give MPs an opportunity to debate a topic of their choice, and receive a response from the Government.
They are a way to:
raise awareness of an issue
seek to influence government policy
put the views of backbench MPs, political parties, and the Government on record.
They do not generally involve a vote on a particular action or decision.
See our visual explainer (https://ukparliament.shorthandstories.com/cet-backbench-business-debates/index.html) on how these debates work.
Your UK Parliament newsletter
Sign up (https://parliament.us14.list-manage.com/subscribe?u=098af33234df9814f59fb205f&id=6e29cb1262) to a regular newsletter on the work of Parliament and how to get involved.
